review: This is just an FYI post of my experience with the Amazon Fire T V box that cost me $99.00 less than a year ago. The device no longer works. All of the icons are not on the tv screen. The only thing tha appears is a blue screen. I've removed the cords from my initial set up and reversed them. I replaced the batteries in the remote. I've held down every button on the remote for s long period of time and I still end up with a blue screen or a gray screen with a notice telling me that there is no signal. I'm very unhappy about this product taking a big dump in less than a year. Oh, I forgot, I did seek out tech support and it would cost me $35.00 of the problem was fixed. I have not done this yet. Also, I haven't been able to find an 800 phone number for Amazon.Calvin James Everly
author: Calvin Everly

review: I'm very disappointed in this product! It's difficult to use and has no easy function to access the free stuff... that, by the way, isn't much!! I got this to avoid getting pay cable service but, after seeing how much everything I wanted to use cost and how often...its DEFINITELY NOT a cheaper alternative!! Several of the "FREE" apps require a pay cable service to even use them so, what's the point??!!?? I'm taking my Fire TV box back to BestBuy for a REFUND and getting AT&T; U-verse installed. If you watch a lot of TV and like watching current release movies, DONT BUY FIRE TV SERVICE...it's NOT a BARGAIN!!!! WORST OF ALL...I paid $100.00 bucks for the box, $10.00 a month for Prime membership and I "STILL!" have to watch mind numbing commercials between clips on FREE channels!! REALLY??!!?? STUPID...STUPID... STUPID!!!!!!
